thread.title: UPDATE: Parts of I-95 closed in South Carolina
thread.title_full: UPDATE: Parts of I-95 closed in South Carolina | savannahnow.com

author: Savannah Morning News
title: UPDATE: Parts of I-95 closed in South Carolina
text:
Photos A vehicle is stranded on Cainhoy Road due to flood waters near Huger, S.C., Monday, Oct. 5, 2015. South Carolina is still struggling with flood waters due to a slow moving storm system. (AP Photo/Mic Smith) Related Links PHOTOS: South Carolina Flooding By Savannah Morning News The South Carolina Department of Transportation said it is closing a 70-mile section of Interstate 95 between Florence and Interstate 26.
Expected clearance time is Tuesday at 9 a.m.
From earlier:
The Georgia Department of Transportation says flooding has caused approximately 90 miles of Interstate 95 northbound and southbound in South Carolina to be closed around mile marker 86.
Traffic is being detoured. Officials say clearance time should be around 11 p.m. today. Motorists are advised to seek alternate routes and should check conditions before traveling. Call 1-877-511-4672 or visit www.511sc.org .
Also, a flash flood watch is in effect for several counties in northeast Georgia as tropical moisture spins into the area. The watch extends into Monday morning. Officials advise caution when driving in the rain.
